medical_history.chief_complaint: Congenital hyperinsulinism associated with mutations in HNF1A and HNF4A.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Case 1 presented with neonatal hypoglycemia that appeared to resolve after 72 hours of life, but symptoms suggestive of hypoglycemia returned at 20 months with a diagnosis of hyperinsulinism established. Improvement occurred with diazoxide treatment, showing complete resolution by age 6. Case 2 diagnosed at 3 months with a hypoglycemic seizure showed controlled hyperinsulinism on diazoxide, with resolution noted by 42 months. Case 3 developed severe hypoglycemia shortly after birth, requiring IV dextrose, and showed diazoxide-responsive hyperinsulinism that improved with lower doses over the years. Notably, all cases showed improvement of hyperinsulinism with age.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Case 1 had a family history of adult-onset diabetes in the father and paternal relatives. Case 2 had no significant past medical conditions noted. Case 3 exhibited symptoms suggesting renal Fanconi syndrome and hepatic glycogenosis linked to a known MODY1 mutation in HNF4A; no history of diabetes in the family was documented.
medical_history.family_history: Family histories included adult-onset diabetes in the father of Case 1 and no diabetes or related conditions mentioned in Cases 2 and 3.
